conclusion: To determine heat absorption or release from A to B, analyze the process using thermodynamics.
Process A→B is isothermal, meaning constant temperature.
In an isothermal process for an ideal gas, internal energy remains constant.
First law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W.
In isothermal expansion A→B, gas does work on surroundings, W = nRT ln(VB/VA).
Since VB > VA, work done W is positive.
For isothermal process, ΔU = 0, so Q = W.
Since W is positive, Q is also positive, indicating heat absorption.
The gas absorbs heat when moving from state A to state B.
